results.title: Winterfun Canada
results.creator_credit: Jim Turpie, Crawley Films and Pat Crawley
results.brief_description: This film is a lively mosaic of how Canadians use winter as a source of recreation and entertainment. We go from coast to coast catching a view of virtually every winter sport and outdoor pastime - from the grace of figure skating to the mayhem of a car race on a frozen lake. Aside from all the action, the camera often stops along the way and lingers on the frozen stillness of the long Canadian Winter. No narration.

results.title: Winter sleepers = Winterschlafer
results.creator_credit: Stefan Arndt, X filme creative Pool, Filmstiftung NRW, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, Palladio Film, WDR, Mitteldeutscher Rundfunk, Arte, BMI, Bavaria Film, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, German Independents and Tom Tykwer
results.brief_description: Tykwer’s elaborately designed second feature, which preceded his commercially successful ‘Run Lola Run’ (1998), is set in a ski village in a remote province in southern Germany. The plot follows the various threads that connect the confused lives of two couples in their thirties. Theo, a projectionist in the local theatre, steals a car belonging to lovers Rebecca and Marco and takes it for a joyride. He collides with the car of a local farmer gravely injuring his daughter, but due to a short term memory loss, leaves the scene without helping the injured girl or her family. Later he becomes involved with Laura, a nurse, who has been taking care of the girl. Both couples are rootless and without ambition or drive, and Tywker uses the time allowed by his elliptical narrative to compare and contrast the two relationships on display. He deploys stylistic formalism to make connections between what are essentially shallow characters. Their incompatibilities are underpinned by the use of colour-coding, while the repeated use of lap dissolves sets up unexpected connections between them. Cast includes Floriane Daniel, Heino Ferch, Ulrich Matthes, Marie-Lou Sellem and Josef Bierbichler. In German with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stefan Arndt, X filme creative Pool, Filmstiftung NRW, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, Palladio Film, WDR, Mitteldeutscher Rundfunk, Arte, BMI, Bavaria Film, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, German Independents and Tom Tykwer

results.title: Winter of the witch
results.creator_credit: Thomas Sand, Parents' Magazine Films, Learning Corporation of America and Gerald Herman
results.brief_description: Nicky and his mother buy an old house where a three hundred-year-old witch lives. Each day Nick brings her the paper and she realizes that everyone is so sad that there is no need to scare them anymore. She becomes the family cook and amazes everyone with her “happiness” pancakes, until her motive is revealed. Based on “Old Black Witch” by Wende and Harry Devlin. Narrated by Burgess Meredith. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thomas Sand, Parents’ Magazine Films, Learning Corporation of America and Gerald Herman

results.title: Winter of our dreams
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, John Duigan and Vega Film Productions
results.brief_description: An unstable relationship develops between prostitute Louise (Judy Davis), and a married man Rob (Bryan Brown), following the suicide of a mutual friend, Lisa. Lou (Davis), who is left with Lisa’s diaries becomes infatuated by her friend’s life and unrequited passion for Rob. She attempts to assume Lisa’s identity, in appearance, thoughts and actions, which poses the viewer with the question, will she too end her life? Lou sees in Rob an avenue for salvation from her life of drug addiction and prostitution. It is a destructive relationship, with Rob giving her little encouragement or hope. Rob is drawn to Lou for the possible insight she can offer into the years that passed between his sudden departure from Lisa and his now, unconventional marriage. Ultimately, it is a one sided relationship and Lou must decide whether she can make something of her life. Cast includes Bryan Brown, Judy Davis, Cathy Downes and Baz Luhrmann.

results.title: Winter moths
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ackroyd, Shell Film Unit and J.V. Durden
results.brief_description: Describes in detail the life cycle and habits of the true winter moth; the attack on the flower buds of fruit tress and later the much more destructive assaults on their foliage. Shows also the destruction caused by the March moth.

results.title: Winter light = Nattvardsgarterna
results.brief_description: The second film in his trilogy on faith, “Winter light” springs from Bergman’s desire to define Man’s relation to God - if He exists. A village pastor, unloved and empty of faith, reveals his bitter failure to offer spiritual consolation to his flock. Sombre and poignant, the film sketches a world of half-empty churches - but a world not entirely without hope in God’s universe. The story brings together four personalities in a shared quest for siritual reassurance. A susceptible and disillusioned fisherman (Max von Sydow) is urged by his wife (Gunnel Lindboim) to seek solace from his local priest (Gunnar Bjornstrand). However the priest is struggling to regain his own belief - a tragic and intimately depicted conflict, in which he is eventually supported by the cynical resilience of the local schoolmistress (Ingrid Thulin). Swedish language with English subtitles.

results.title: Winter garden. Sailor's consolation. Check to song
results.creator_credit: Michael Warne, Joan Maude, John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and British Film Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The second part of a series devised by Joan Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of three short films. ‘Winter garden’ by David Gascoigne, narrated by Michael Redgrave, painted by Barbara Jones (2:17 mins). ‘The Sailor’s consolation’ by Thomas Dibden, narrated by Stanley Holloway, drawings by John Minton (1:40 mins). ‘Check to song!’ by Owen Meredith, narrated by Eric Portman, drawings by Michael Warre (1:10 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.

results.title: Winter Express
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and Anthony Loeb
results.brief_description: The story of a one-man small town weekly newspaper and the man who run it in Winters, California. The publisher is also a reporter, editor, printer, and distributor. Tells how a weekly functions and how is reflects the virtues of a small town in the United States - an example of the free press.

results.title: Winter comes to the forest
results.brief_description: A study of the many ways that living things are adapted for living through the winter. The forest looks cold, bare, and dead, but a closer look reveals buds containing tiny leaves, the cocoon of a moth, a chickadee looking for insect eggs, rabbit tracks in the snow, and seeds that will grow next spring.

results.title: Winter at Mount Buffalo
results.brief_description: Holiday at Mount Buffalo, a skier’s paradise. Novices are taught how to ski and how not to ski. Demonstrations of herring bone and side stepping up steep slopes, balance and control for slalom beginners; the thrill of a snow-jump and an exhilarating 60 miles per hour run by experts.
